The Brief

Every exponential technology follows a learning curve. AI is on the steepest one we've ever measured. I help the people deploying capital understand what that means.

Founder of Exponential View · Author of Exponential (FT Best Book 2021) · Executive Fellow, Harvard Business School

The Argument

A pragmatic optimist who has spent two decades building, investing in, and advising on exponential technologies.

We are in the early innings of the most significant repricing event since the internet. AI and adjacent exponential technologies — energy, biotech, robotics — are collapsing cost curves at rates that make traditional forecasting models unreliable. The firms and funds that understand this will generate outsized returns. Those that don't will misallocate capital at scale.

I don't just analyse exponential technologies — I invest in them, I've built companies with them, and I've spent a decade tracking the energy transition that powers them. When I brief a board on AI economics, I'm drawing on operator experience, not just research.

I don't do policy. I do deployment: where the money goes, why it compounds, and what the second-order effects look like for your portfolio, your sector, your firm.

My work is built for the room where allocation decisions get made.

Where This Matters

Five positions on where value migrates next

Economics & Growth

AI could restart exponential growth by making intelligence accumulable like capital. But it might also narrow the frontier of discovery.

Strategy & Transformation

Three inputs to civilisation crossed from extraction to engineering. Every institution built for scarcity is running yesterday's software.

Energy & Infrastructure

AI's growth constraint has moved from capital and code to concrete and copper. Physics, not software, is the bottleneck.

AI Infrastructure

Trillions of AI agents need economic infrastructure that doesn't exist yet. Identity, payments, and trust at machine speed.

Investment & Finance

Everyone is looking for an AI bubble. The data says stampede. The real danger is timidity, not exuberance.

Productivity & AI

Each order of magnitude in AI token usage transforms the technology's nature — from toy to colleague to workforce.

Geopolitics & Technology

The borderless internet is dead. The global technology economy is splitting into US-led and China-led sovereign stacks.

Markets & Investment

Why $650 billion in AI investment is not a bubble — and may not be enough. A five-gauge framework for telling the difference.

Economy & Productivity

AI is the third general purpose technology in a century. We are in the messy middle — and that is exactly where the opportunity lies.
